newsitem.title: INDIA: Ten injured in Kashmir grenade attacks.
newsitem.headline: Ten injured in Kashmir grenade attacks.

text.p: At least 10 people including five Indian paramilitary troops were injured on Saturday in two grenade attacks in busy market places in the heart of troubled Kashmir's summer capital, police said.

They said suspected separatist guerrillas lobbed a hand grenade at an army patrol in the crowded Regal chowk in the heart of Srinagar, seriously injuring three soldiers and hurting four female students.
The soldiers opened fire in panic, but no one was hurt in the firing, police said.
Two paramilitary soldiers were wounded when suspected separatist guerrillas hurled another grenade at a patrol at Maulana Azad Road, only 100 metres (yards) from Regal, police said.

Over a dozen militant groups are fighting New Delhi's rule in Jammu and Kashmir, India's only Moslem majority state, where police and hospitals say more than 20,000 people have been killed in a seven-year-old rebellion.
